If there's such a thing as bad sex, this is the move equivalent.
Not worth your T I M E. Horrible experience don't even bother.

What a mess! This film is a total disaster that wants to be a dozen things at once and fails at being anything at all. It would be comically bad for Armie Hammer's performance; I don't think I've ever seen an actor try harder to make lemonade out of a lemon like this script. Unlike Dakota Johnson, who-speaking of phones!-is truly phoning it in with her acting (albeit in a surprisingly small onscreen role, given that she's billed as the co-star and is playing the girlfriend, but honestly this is the least of this film's problems).Where to even begin?First off, it starts with a Conrad quote from the literary masterpiece, Heart of Darkness. And that says a lot about Wounds' biggest, most glaring flaw of all: it wants so badly to have MEANING. This technology! These phones! Look what it's doing to the youth, to SOCIETY, man? You could have made a movie about an evil cursed cellphone that seeks to awaken alien spirits (?)-which this movie is also about, believe it or not-and not tried to do overt social commentary. That movie might have also been terrible, but hey... options.During one of the endless streams of bad dialogue, one character calls another character "a mock person." And that stuck with me, because this is a mock movie. It doesn't know what it wants to be. Hard horror. Satirical critique. Interpersonal relationship drama. But, in addition to Hammer giving it his all, the film looks like a film. It's visually competent and there are actually some nice shots. But, alas, this is a mock movie. It takes elements that would otherwise be a major or *the* major crux on their own (the college kids and the cellphone stuff, the Afghanistan war, Dakota Johnson being sucked into a laptop void, cockroaches! etc etc etc) and lets them all rot. No threads are either elaborated on OR completed. Your theory on what any of this means is correct. Congratulations!You'll likely stick around for the "catch." Of course you will, even if you know it's gonna be incredibly underwhelming. Or in this case: absent. Everything is unearned and half-baked. And by the end of it, when the cockroaches are literally crawling on the camera lens, you'll be left wishing they'd been there the entire time to shield you from having watched this nonsense.

The rare people on here who are giving this more than a 1 searching for a deeper meaning to this film need to stop clutching at straws and admit this film is pointless. Its not an indie film or a Hollywood film. Its boring and didnt capture me at all, It doesn't explain basically anything and has left me annoyed I wasted my time. Don't bother!
I had to give a 4 because the acting is very good but if you watch it you'll be left non the wiser, to the reason or the plot but definitely a despisement of cock roaches!

reviews.review_title: It only had a hearing on Netflix.
reviews.content: A very weak movie with good actors. I was not scared at any time, all attempts were failed. No sense in cockroaches.

reviews.review_title: Not for people who need everything explained

If you like Lovecraftian horror and also find horror films more effectively scary when they don't explain everything that happens, you will enjoy this film. reviews.review_title: Perplexing plot with a few good ideas
reviews.content: I like some elements of this movie. It's does't take for a conventional plot which started out good but by the end I was left scratching my head. It hasn't that it was confusing but just odd. I didn't really understand why the film took this route towards the ending. It almost seemed farcical. The characters are unlikeable and unbelievable. I liked this movie for more or less the first half before it really got self absorbed into a plot I don't think worked. I will give the movie credit for trying something slightly different.

bar fightfound phonethings get creepylost phonethings get creepiercheats on gfgf gets creepybreaks up with gfgets fired from work"make me whole"Please do not waste your time on this. Please.

reviews.review_title: A complete waste of everyone's time
reviews.content: This film is extremely slow moving from start to finish, and gradually introduces what seem to be plot points. However, they are never brought together into any coherent story at all. The entire film is therefore nonsensical, and just ends with nothing explained or resolved. It is puzzling how rubbish like this gets filmed. Why did nobody read the script and say, 'Hang on, this is just babble. Let's not proceed.'?

I thought this was a brilliantly executed mystery. Had me on the edge of my seat throughout and the performances were great. It isn't a Hollywood type movie, more of an independent feel. Check it out!

There was no connection of the movie whatsoever, it was all over the place, the ending was rushed and leaves you more questions than answers., this was a 3 for me but +1 because Dakota Johnson and Armie Hammer are some of my fave actors .The story really sucks though., if it had deeper meaning, it was not thoroughly explained in the movie.

reviews.review_title: So much potential so much crap.
reviews.content: I'm was looking for something that made you think, made you squirm in your seat, made you cringe and made you want to talk about it with your friends and all I got was "what?".Visually a nice looking film and that is about the only positive thing I can say about it.I have to admit that I personally cannot stand Dakota Johnson, she has zero acting ability and precence.

I watched this movie because of Dakota Johnson. I kept thinking that it would make sense in a little while. But, that never happened.This movie is basically like a prank on the viewer who keeps waiting for it to develop into a worthwhile story, other than a tale about a lose bartender with a nowhere job, who's life is spiraling out of control, his fixation for a woman even though he has a lovely girlfriend who's going to school to better herself. Oh yeah and bugs. Lots of bugs, but no real explanation about how they relate to the lame plot. And I use the term plot loosely.Don't bother watching this awful waste of time.

reviews.review_title: I feel wounded by watching this
reviews.content: It started very promising, but instead of maybe following a more traditional horror route, it started to go on some weird psychological tangent. Really this is just about a man who ends up being about a man descending into alcoholism. The last 30 minutes is a real drag. The only good thing is the beautiful Zazie Beats.

Like most modern-day horror films, this is about as frightening as a lamb. And, again like most, the ending makes zero sense, as does most of the film, actually. But the acting wasn't bad, if that's any consolation.

reviews.review_title: How is an Armie Hammer movie this bad?
reviews.content: The script is terrible. The plot is awful. No one seems to know what's going on or why they're there. It's just... ergh.

reviews.review_title: Should have just read the book.
reviews.content: When will Hollywood stop hiring Armie Hammer an actor preoccupied with finding his good angles rather than delivering a believable performance. Believe me, I've tried, but this is another wooden acting class except for a nonsensical script about cockaroaches. Sorry I can't be more constructive but this isn't worth anyone's time.

Mmm... I seem to disagree with the other viewers and reviewers, which is interesting. It keeps you glued to your screen because you don't know what it is and you want to know, but the actual meaning of the ritual doesn't exactly become a hundred percent clear. I mean, who's gaining access to what higher power?On top of that, it's the fear of fright and everything that's put inside the characters' heads that makes this movie work, with some kind of supernatural entity that is real and horrors that both are and aren't? It's pretty vague in terms of what the thing driving the horror is, but the character conflict and the suspense and the not knowing are really well-defined.So, the characters aren't exactly the most having-it-all-together kinds of people. Everyone in some way is pretty messed up.Horror fueling drama is an interesting creative decision and it feels like what you might expect of the first horror stories being written in terms of suspense and fear, cutting back to earlier times in the genre, with a basic modern twist to the genre through the cellphone and Internet.To me it was well-executed, with a both interesting and unexpected cleansing of the innocent scene and firing up of the depravation of the already depraved, consuming the rot of what's found in one's own soul by taking that of another.It's different. I like it.

reviews.review_title: Your headache will get a wound watching it.
reviews.content: A BIG NOTHING. A bit disturbing concept, had a potential, but writers got sloppy and ended up killing it rather than the cockroaches.

I love the actors in this movie and it started so well, but two thirds in it loses its way quickly and I just don't get it. It's not the fault of the actors, it's the story which is crazy. The end is weird, it makes no sense at all. It's a shame as it could have been brilliant, a real head scratcher this one.

This is just one of the worst movis ive ever wasted my time on , cause i watched it to the end thinking surely it cant be this bad. But nope nothing adds up most of it makes no sense and seems like they just kept adding any idea they coculd manage . Didnt matter if it had to do with the story line. Written Horribly , Casting Bluh , I dont know why anyone with a chance in hollywood would be caught on this set! its truly that bad....... DONT WASTE YOUR TIME!

I'm all for a "weird" or unique film... even if it's not fully explained in the end. But this... THIS... is something else, and not in a good way. I only gave it 5 stars because Armie and Dakota are great, and the beginning starts out decent and somewhat interesting, but even the actors can't save this movie. NOTHING, and I mean NOTHING, is explained in the end. It's basically like "hey let's throw in a bunch of scary, gross, frightening clips of things, but have none of it make any sense and nothing is revealed"... who said "ok great! Let's make that movie!"??... Lots of cockroaches, severed heads, creepy scenes and great acting from Armie but that's about it. (Why did he even make this movie??) Watch it ironically with someone so you can laugh about it together afterwards. Otherwise, just skip it.

Movie normally have a start middle and an end. This movie had a start......
literally the worst movie I've ever seen. I kept watching waiting for the storyline but nah it just kept getting worse. Look stuff happens but you won't know why or what's going on.I hope the writers of this movie retire or get a new job.

From the beginning I could tell that this movie was trying to merge 'unfriended dark web' and 'sinester' into a story about a found lost phone... But it failed terribly, it missed the mark on what could have been a successful movie if the focus on the characterisation wasn't so strong, the film didn't have enough scares and wasted the opportunities it could have used to deliver a terryfying lesson to never try to delve into the life of a strangers phone.

reviews.review_title: If it's possible to have so little plot you go into the negative, this movie manages it
reviews.content: Skip this mess and use your time for something better, like watching a pot of water boil. I've seen movies before that I thought had no plot, but this was less than zero plot, somehow. It is devoid of plot to the point it sucked everything potentially good out. It's like the writer had a series of ideas for scenarios to put a character in, but no clue how to string them together into something coherent, and no desire to give explanation for anything that happened. The ending was a joke.As far as the acting, Hammer was mediocre, and Johnson was so bland and lifeless I wondered at times if they'd just had a bored crew member stand in to read lines for Hammer to respond to instead of getting an actual actor. The supporting cast were much more interesting, so maybe it could've been something good from their POV, watching their friend spiral into a breakdown. Unfortunately, that's not the movie that was made, and we're stuck with ~90 minutes of rotten garbage.

reviews.review_title: Aldous in 'Forgetting Sarah Marshall' said it best...
reviews.content:
"What would happen if your mobile phone killed you?How can a mobile phone have an agenda and kill people?Why not just take the battery out? "
Truly an awful, awful waste of time - it's like they made a chimpanzee watch Cronenberg body horror classics mixed with 'Saw'. Said chimpanzee was then put in a room with a laptop open to Word, it then peed on, pooped on and threw at the walls.The laptop was retrieved and whatever garbled Word document survived became the script for 'Wounds'

reviews.review_title: A suspenseful start that builds to NOTHING
reviews.content: This film had a decent and intriguing premise and good acting for the most part. It is intentionally confusing with what is going on with the phone, which I could forgive if there was some sort of resolution. But the movie literally has no ending, it just stops and cuts to credits leaving you feeling like WTF did I just watch. I like weird/ disturbing movies sometimes but I also expect them to have a proper ending. I'm not saying everything needs to be explained, but in this movie NOTHING is made even remotely comprehensible by the end. So if you want to feel confused and angry, this is the movie for you.

I can't find anything good to say about this movie. First and most importantly the story is virtually nonexistent. Seriously, what the hell was that? There was no story here, it's just pure nonsense. Second, it was boring! I fell asleep during the first half. Note to the director: if the viewers can fall asleep while watching a HORROR movie, the movie is not doing its job! Horror movie should be scary and keep you on the edge of your seat. Third, the acting was not good! Maybe it wasn't the actors fault but their behavior was not believable at all.Do yourself a favor and skip it!

It's like this happened for no reason now there doing something els that has nothing to do with the plot now this is happening out of nowhere and they know why but we don't. I know stupid. Acting is great but the story, plot and horror is in short supply. A few times I was like I know what's going to happen then boom it's another story. The college kids are never seen again and was only there to lose the phone. And I'm sure it wasn't even them that lost it. Anyway don't bother.

reviews.review_title: Not even close to as bad as all these reviews are saying.
reviews.content: If you read the Visible Filth by Nathan Ballingrud,which is what this movie is based on, then your going to love this movie. I feel like all the reviewers here are coming into this movie cold and without any background. You honestly don't have to read the story to enjoy the movie but I feel you would get a little bit more out of it. The acting is awesome, the pacing is perfect, and the production values are top-notch and it all aligns perfectly with the short story. The director did an amazing job adapting this to the small screen. This is by far better than over half the stuff you see on Netflix and Hulu or Amazon. So if you're even a little bit interested I would give it a shot. There wasn't one moment where I was bored or thought maybe I should turn it off. I look forward to more from this director and some of these actors. Armie Hammer really did a great job.

The trailer seemed like it had potential...thats the only positive thing I have to say about it.
I've had scarier bowel movements that had more of a journey then this movie. In those scary moments where I was backing one out, I had a start, a middle and an end, but the most important part was that there was a point to what is was doing.
Please avoid this movie

reviews.review_title: A horror with a lot of unanswered questions
reviews.content:
When I was told to avoid watching this film cause it was that bad, obviously that boosted my interest to see what was so bad about it and so I gave it a watch..A film about a bartender who finds a mobile phone left behind at his work and instead of doing the right thing and leaving it with staff he decides to take it home with him.
After discovering the phone pin code, the bartender gains access to the phone where he discovers disturbing images and video that become the start of the unusual encounters he experiences.This film had potential, I was so intrigued when watching the trailer and learning that Dakota Johnson was also staring in this Netflix original. But it just hit the spot for me... Spooky stuff happened with no real answers to what was going on.
Then when things begin to spice up and get interesting, it simply ends...I did read that it ended the way it does on purpose to cause chatter amongst viewers to what they think happens next, but I thought it was dumb move. When the credits came out I was actually shocked it ended the way it did and started to think about all the unanswered questions.Anyways, wish I had listened to my friend about this one, it's not a great film whats so ever. Just a time killer.

There's lots to be said about how nothing makes sense or connects in any way. The movie is more or less just a sequence of random disconnected stuff thrown together.But that's not my biggest issue. My biggest issue is that the main guy doesn't have an ounce of rational judgment. Here are some examples.1. He comes home late, finding his girlfriend glued to her laptop watching some creepy endless animation. Asking her about it, it turns out she has amnesia and doesn't remember anything that happened. Given this overwhelming evidence for something extremely serious and dangerous going on, his reaction is to not talk about it further and break up with her at the next day for fairly unrelated reasons.2. After the above, he doesn't attempt to do anything whatsoever that could possibly resolve the situation. He just goes back to work and gets in trouble being rude to other people there.3. Near the end of the movie, after being confronted with even more evidence of weird supernatural and dangerous stuff, he calls some woman he's close to, and uses this opportunity to... tell her that he's left his girlfriend and complain that she doesn't want to leave her boyfriend. The fact that he's being in a horror movie right now and his life is probably in danger is utterly inconsequential to what he decides to talk about. That was baffling to watch.I just want to have my characters behave in a way that makes sense in their respective situations. That's kinda essential for good story telling! This movie utterly fails to deliver on that front. And it's not like the point is that he's losing his mind; this isn't being conveyed and his actions never made sense in the first place. He's just a gigantic idiot, and watching him is very annoying.At least the movie could have been nice enough to kill him for some satisfaction, but alas.The directing is pretty good though. Decent atmosphere. Credit where it's due.

It is very sad to realize that most of the viewers out there want films that are ... well, films that are the opposite of Wounds. I found this one near perfect and now I'm getting overprotective, so instead of 8 or 9, I'll award this film 10. For me it made perfect sense (not too much though; that would have meant I'm more clever than the film was, and I am in most of the cases) and the way dread is built up is quite unique. Arnie Hammer is top notch and the rest of the cast do a very decent job as well. The ending... sure, it's puzzling, but give it a thought and I think you'll be able to fill the void if you really try. One of my favourite flicks!

reviews.review_title: Horror cuz of insects n blood?
reviews.content: If you scare those things you will be scared. Otherwise look at the story itself nothing to be scared at all.

I like the cast (except Dakota Johnson, who might be one of the worst actresses I've seen), so I thought this would be a good horror movie. It relies on gross imagery, and not a lot of scares, and the ending? Well, they really should have made one.

After a fairly savage bar brawl, bartender Will (Hammer) retrieves a phone from the wreckage of the scene and takes it home. It isn't long before he begins receiving disturbing content and ambiguous messages from unknown contacts, sending him spiralling into an unhealthy obsession that tears his life apart from the inside. Following this decent if slightly unremarkable set up, writer/director Anvari's sophomore effort spirals into nonsensical garbage. Based on Nathan Ballingrud's novella The Visible Filth, Wounds is the very definition of a film that is all tease and no pay off. Every character introduced to us is unlikable, which is a shame given the talent involved. Hammer, Beetz and Dakota Johnson (appearing as Will's dead behind the eyes girlfriend Carrie) make do with what they've got, but in the end no performance is remotely captivating. It felt as though production began without a completed script, as character motivations are often unclear and practically nothing regarding the supernatural disturbances are explained. Dull, uninspired and badly paced, Wounds is a monumental waste of time with a sickeningly unsatisfying conclusion.
Save yourself the time and watch anything else, even Made In Chelsea or something just don't watch this

As you may have wasted enough life on this film. Should you have had the misfortune of actually watching it.
It's a mess. There's no real plot to speak of. The acting falls short of school nativity. Nothing makes sense or explains anything that happens in the film. The characters are 2 dimensional and by the end you just hope they all end up disappearing up their own tunnel.
Watch something else.

Some try to defend and justify this movie by saying it's artistic and it's fresh, trying to bring something new. Bulls**t. This is pure garbage. A movie that is getting nowhere under 90 minutes, not anserwing any quesiton, not finishing any storyline is just a selfserving bad picture. It's not art when you throw random scenenes after each other.

I really enjoyed this movie and wish they would have done more with the ending, but it definitely leaves you wanting more. I'd be thrilled if they came out with a second one that dealt more with the mythos behind the first one.

reviews.review_title: This movie can't decide what it wants to be
reviews.content: This movie failed for me for 2 reasons1) There are no continuity in any of the things that were happening in the entire movie. They are just all over the place. The next scenes doesn't explain the previous (like ever). The movie just throws things at the viewer in a random manner and it just got so confusing and without(or weak) logic, making the viewers (me) frustrated. This could be just horrible story telling.2) The movie doesn't know what it should be. Feels like the focus keeps shifting. Nothing really takes off. Nothing really got built on enough. I honestly stopped caring half-way through.3) The main character is unlikable. At first he seems cool with that deep voice, but then it just turns out that he is a weak minded individual without any charisma. He called the bunch of college kids millennial(s), but he kind of represents one. The only char I think is interesting and got potential is Alicia.Sorry. 3 reasons actually.

Just kidding, this is a mess. A horrible, horrible mess. The first 30 minutes or so have some good acting, some good character building, and started to ask some good questions.You will not get an answer to any question you ask in this movie. There will be no resolution, nor character archs. This is simply a bad, bad movie.The only thing that is scary about this is that you don't realize it's bad until it is too late. Do not stay that extra 40 min because you think, 'we'll they gotta explain something...'
Spoiler.
They don't.

Before you score this movie 2, have a think about it...Spoilers ahead.So, what's this movie about then?To me it was how technology can infest the mind.
The bartenders life appears fairly confident at the start of the movie. He's likes by his customers, has a hot girlfriend and does the right thing by calling the cops at the bar fight.His life turns however as soon as technology come in to play. Once he gets on that phone his partner questions him and he isn't himself anymore.
The thoughts plague his mind and jar his views on what is real and right in front of him.
Everytime a phone or computer screen is seen in this movie something bad happens.The guy gets that wrapped up in this other world his real life crumbles and blurs before him. That's what I think this movie is all about and when you think back on it with this in mind, it all makes a little more sense...

reviews.review_title: Disappointing, had the ingredients to be a good film
reviews.content: Wounds: A confused and confusing film about a bartender who finds a phone with disturbing vids/images of brutal killings on it. Strange things happen to him and people close to him. Lots of flies and bugs infest rooms and cars. This is a tale of a Gnostic ritual gone wrong or possibly having it's intended effect as a demon comes across and moves from host to host. Wounds has all the ingredients to be a good horror film but in spite of good acting and some terrifying scenes it fails to convince. Written and directed by Babak Anvari (who gave us the great Under The Shadow). 5/10. On Netflix.
No clue what happened in the film other than bartender tryna cheat on his grlfriend and random cockroaches roaming around for no reason. Nothing was explained at all. Dont waste your time

reviews.review_title: Constant Suspense build up that leads to nowhere
reviews.content: Thumbs down. The only thing I will give this film credit for is its ability to hold your attention all throughout the movie that keeps you guessing at what it will lead to, but eventually as the credits roll you realize that it in fact led to nowhere.I had to go and read stuff online about what the fakk did I just watch, but even then it doesn't leave you satisfied. Some promise, but unfortunately wasted and unfulfilled.

This has to be one of the worst movie scripts i have ever witnessed, the only thing that has gotten me through the end of this movie is the decent cast. This is WTF in all the wrong ways, don't waste your time.

Oh I so hate these types of films which a) should have been much better, b) didn't know where it was heading and c) has split genre disorder.To be fair though, it was all good up to the last 10 minutes. You were thinking some sort of hallucinogenic, or hypnosis, or some such thing, but no it bizarrely switches into some weird occult meets science fiction, rushed ending.I know this was adapted from a book, but I'm sure the book must have done a better job with the ending. The ending takes place over the final 2 minutes.I'd be really disappointed if the 'real' ending was over in two or three pages.I don't get the skimping on the ending, or things earlier to explain the ending, its not as if this was a long film.When I say explain, I don't mean 'join the dots for me', but you have to give more than a 2 second screen shot of an occult website.The series of events supposedly started with the phone - how, why?Who was following in the Dodge Charger? Why?What were the photos about? And the visions?How did Eric get the phone? In fact what is Eric even got to do with any of the events between the initial fight and the final scene?And what's with the Tunnel?? If this is Occult, how does that work pre-computers? - But even still what's the significance of the tunnel? Or the high pitched phone call - If its not hypnosis or subliminal messages, what is it? How it is related to the ending?Why did Will suddenly go from gradual mental breakdown to 'I'm an evil spirit who can summon roaches' and play host to an outer dimensional creature?

reviews.review_title: I can't give spoilers because there was no plot!
reviews.content: One of the worst movies I've ever seen. Acting and filming was okay. But there was absolutely NO PLOT! Nothing made sense at all. Random stuff. Dude cheats on girlfriend. Girlfriend not happy. Some underage teen leaves a phone in a bar. Cockroaches! Hate cockroaches? There's cockroaches for no reason!People follow in a car. People send text messages. No reason why. Oh, and magic! And a tunnel!Avoid this movie like the useless plague that it is.

This movie should have never been released what is it even about a man getting a phone and started acting crazy and seeing things pure nonsense and extremely extremely boring. I had to go to Wikipedia to try and understand the movie.
Basically nothing much happens but what starts happening is set off in a bar, a bar tender takes a cell phone that then takes over and things happen. It really isn't worth watching at all.
I feel the movie was based more on the cockroaches than the people. No plot I was lost the entire movie
Incredible performances and scenario. Dakota Johnson awesome. I like this movie. Enjoy
Dont whats this movie, its waste of time. I dont like at all. :(

Honestly, there's really not a lot to add, except that Dakota Johnson is hot. I feel like I'm giving this a 2/10 only because of that.

The movie was really bad. Didn't expect it Netflix, what was the story?!? NOTHING.
at the start things looks interesting but then it just going to Drama with lot of insects. Don't waist your time...

reviews.content: If there is any other movie dumber than that i am not going to watch a film again. This is incredibly nonsense and stupid

The opening quote is really the whole movie. If you're In the mood for a little lovecraft horror this movie is pretty good. spoilers: alot of people are saying this movie just ends with no explanation but if you keep the opening quote in mind, the ending makes so much sense. Throughout the movie, the bartender Will seems to have a pretty good life with plenty of people who's always happy to see him. When he picks up the phone from the college students (small cultist group maybe?) they planted a device and he happens to pick it up and called a phone number through that phone which activates the device. The phone then acts as a portal for higher beings to come to our world. But they need a hollow vessel. Wills life slowly becomes more and more empty as he begins to make poor decisions that eventually leads to him having no one and anything. At that time he becomes the perfect vessel and one or more of the higher beings using the wound from eric (man with gash face) to transport through to Eric. As a fan of lovecrafts chuthulu and higher beings from other dimensions this movie was well worth the time.

I'm a pretty generous person when it comes to leaving reviews. But, I literally couldn't tell you what this "horror" movie was about. It has its jumpy parts. There are some cringe worthy scenes, but it's just a mashed up mess of confusing horror and plot. It's even more confusing that actors like Armie Hammer and Dakota Johnson opted to play in this movie. This is a movie I'd do at the beginning of my acting career. Not while my career is in an upswing. It's not bad acting at all. Just one terrible script. Please don't waste your time.

This movie is bad, the pacing is slow, its only 1h30 but it feels like 3hours

Netflix owes me 2 hours of my life back.... still waiting !
Please dont bother to watch this film

reviews.review_title: How stupid does this go, more like?
reviews.content: Oh my god. Avoid at all costs. Can't even begin to describe to you how bad this movie really is. Honestly, it is laughable. The message, or whatever it was trying to give off just took a dive - I mean, I'm being generous saying that, as I'm indicating it was flying high at some point but in reality, there was none of it. I can't actually believe Netflix took this one. It was like some cheap 'High Voltage' production BUT with decent Hollywood A-list actors!! I mean, what the hell was Armie Hammer doing in this?! He is SO much better than these rubbish "cheap scares" !!!!! I'm angered even writing this review. I mean, watch it for the laugh of it all; just to see how stupidly pointless the whole movie is. Nothing makes sense. Acting is so stale. Nothing is believable under the circumstances they're going through. There is no explanation to anything. It's like they wrote a movie and never gave it an ending or Reveal? It's just a load of nonsense. I still don't get it, as does half the population on the planet haha!

Started off well with good acting performances and a really good stygian atmosphere of dread but the director was trying to emulate a Lynchian body horror with a bit of Lovecraftian gnostiscism thrown in and it looked like he hadn't a clue about what he was doing and just overreached himself somewhat.A lot of folks are complaining about the ending but i think it has a lot to do with the Joseph Conrad quote at the beginning of the film, mainly the part "It echoed loudly within him because he was hollow at the core." in that Will is now an empty vessel due to his life falling apart and his mental state being open to the occult to possess him allowing what i presume was the demon/eye at the end to come into our reality and possess Will's hollow receptacle. At least that is what I understood was trying vainly to be conveyed but it was confused and poorly conveyed to the viewer relying on quick glimpses of occult books and the bad choice of actors made it all the worse. Armie and Dakota were just so not the right actors for their roles even though they performed well, they just did not fit in! Or perhaps the alternative understanding is that he was just going insane and everything he was seeing was in his mind which is a somewhat more simplistic explanation of everything in the film?What is it with all these arab directors and producers these days? I haven't seen one decent horror movie from any of them this year or is it maybe we just do not understand the Middle Eastern way of thinking about what a horror movie actually is; perhaps this is the Iranian horror style? who knows but this just descended into a confused and arty farty ever so clever crew disaster sadly and comes nowhere near the Turkish movie "Baskin"!Finally, throw in the old cockroach horror cliche for some unknown reason which has been done to death and the film falls flat. If you want to watch a real cockroach classic that disturbed me and even now 40 years later it still gives me the shivers try the excellent creepy Bradford Dillman 1975 cult classic "Bug" - Now that is how to scare with cockroaches, this on the other hand well...meh!

The only reason I did not rate this movie worst is because there were few good random things. For example relationships and fights were looking realistic and somewhat emotional. But the story is not explained, it is good way some things started, for explaining us by showing man searching internet for words like occult...but towards end this got more and more holes. Not finished. I could not believe it finished when I did not expect it to. I am disappointed. This is less about horror and more about negativity. There are feelings of desperation, disappointment, anger and how it is when life just does not make any sense, when we lose people, job, meaning. But it is only analogous to that, with completely bad story and meaningless. Unreal and negative. Not the worst but only because of those few realistic and exciting things like fights, and weird behaviors. But as a whole this is bad. Meaning few good acts and ideas, but bad story. Scary bit, but too negative. Similar to bad dreams and bad real life combined.
Bad acting, boring characters, shallow story and didn't get the ending really disappointed
It was good at the beginning but later on it turned out to be the most disgusting movie I have ever watched ! The actor was good
It started really promisingly, plateaued and then nothing made any sense. Ending was incredibly poor and unsatisfying. Please don't waste your time.

reviews.review_title: Enjoyable, feels like a start of a horror movie through it all.
reviews.content: Nothing was explained in the end which is disappointing.But the movie was fun to watch and kept the same mysterious tone throughout. It has some drama moments and some very chilling and creepy moments. So overall it was fun and kept me interesting.Many horror movies go for some annoying action packed ending, so I do appreciate they didn't do that.Characters are kinda weird and don't make much sense. The girlfriend seems like she is high all the time, don't know if that's how she supposed to be or just terrible acting skills. But again, it was fun.

It's hard to really talk about the plot of this movie without giving too much away. It's one of those "Go in Without Knowing Anything" kind of movies. This is a fantastic follow up of the director's previous movie and Armie Hammer is great as always. This is worth the watch and I think will be a movie people will be talking about for years to come.

I dont understand the low score for this. It's a chilling, visceral, mysterious horror. The acting is solid and the scares well orchestrated.I think the end makes sense and the film isn't being obtuse about its message. Not as strong as the brilliant Under The Shadow but a good follow up.

2019 horror! And tension! A movie that claims to be. I've become like a bad movie magnet by any chance today. It's not good with pleasure, look, I was willing to watch an average horror movie. (see girl next) one, this is two. It's like an interesting movie, and it ends without an end, and I don't believe it's over, and I watched the netflix commercials that followed. Is it really over now?More than 2 points cannot be awarded.

reviews.review_title: Great first half but gets worse
reviews.content: The plot is brilliant. A cell phone that gets messages from an Unknown person and it has some really weird videos and pictures. But the loose ends don't tie up. It is silly that we are left to imagine and think about the ending. But there is absolutely nothing that makes sense. You keep thinking Why and then you give up. I watched the ending a few times to understand and make some sense out of it but my educated guess is that it was just because Armie Hammer picked up the damn phone.

Overall I don't find this to be a good movie. Absolutely nothing is explained, and it doesn't make any sense at all. I don't get how anyone would have created this, looked at it and thought "great, it's done. Ready for Netflix" I really don't get it.
However... I did enjoy some of it. Will was a cool character, and the plot seemed quite interesting at first - finding disturbing photos on some college kid's phone, it could have turned out pretty good - but instead it turned out as nothing..

Weird movie about a guy in a downwards spiral, who seems to get infected by an evil through a mobile phone. Everytime the movie seems to hint at moving forward......nothing happens. And than the movie ends.Maybe it's a big metaphor for addicton, but there's a bigger chance the filmmakers had no clue what they're doing. That might explain the weird and hollow ending. Only plus is a creepy atmosphere and some decent acting.

I enjoyed it! Dark and weird. Good acting. People are trying to read too much into it. It is all explained in the movie about the portal and you see the thing at the end, but it's also about will and how he's hiding his true intentions then spirals down hill and out of control. His wounds are inside.

reviews.review_title: Underrated, with excellent performance by Armie Hammer
reviews.content: This isn't so much horror as an allegory spun as a psychological thriller - there is a strong narrative, but it's subtle, and maybe not what you expect if you thought it would be a conventional horror film. Think Lovecraft, Heart of Darkness and Cronenberg, and you get an idea of what you're in for. The movie pretty much hinges on Armie Hammer being able to make his character's descent into darkness interesting and believable, and he pulls it off. As for the ending, it's the logical if very dark conclusion to the narrative. The protagonist is a man who stared into the abyss, and the abyss stared back and liked what it saw. So, definitely worth a watch, but you need to pay attention, or it will probably not make sense. Bears watching more than once.

This is the second movie after "Suspiria" I watch just because I want more of Dakota Johnson after watching her preternatural performance in the "Fifty Shades of Grey" trilogy, and it's terribly bad once again. I'm disappointed in Dakota's choices of roles.
No story, no resolve, no characters with charisma.

reviews.review_title: I think I got it...no wait
reviews.content: So it started well then got progressively worse and then ended with...well nothing.It tells a story of rituals, kids in a car, wounds that are portals etc.. but it's all a bit of a mess. The main character did his best and that's the only reason I could watch it all.They took the phone, they gave it back, they possessed his gf? Cockroaches?Don't bother

It might seem like you did, because by the end of the film it feels like you missed all the exposition and explanations of what was going on.
I know films don't always need to explain everything, that leaving things up to the viewer's imagination can be a powerful tool, but to do this you have to give the audience at least a few clues or pieces to the puzzle. This film provides no clues.
It's such a sad waste of potential, as I feel this movie could have been really something. The acting is good, especially from Armie Hammer as Will - drifting through life, somehow convincing himself he is content with his dead end job (that lets him get drunk every night), his relationship (Will and Carrie are more like two strangers sharing a bed). His only "interest" in life is Alisha, and possibly only because he knows she is unavailable.
There are so many ignored threads that could have been woven together into a taut supernatural thriller - the messages and photos on the mysterious phone; the growing number of bugs everywhere; the tunnel and the strange effect it has on Carrie; why was Will considered "chosen"; the "wounds of translation"...
If only the author of the original novella had allowed someone else to screen-write and direct the film - they might have been able to pull a cohesive story out of the weeds.

reviews.review_title: Half of a good movie half of a crap movie
reviews.content: The first half is very good, sets a good tone and atmosphere but the second half they ran out of steam in the writing room. Brad Henke is amazing as always but that's about all you can say for the movie due to the second half.

A real waste of time.
Very bad acting, very poor scenario and very boring scenes.

Seriously ???
What the hell even was this movie. Made no sense, just a bunch of random things thrown together, with incredibly annoying characters, and a dumbass ending

Muddled hardly does it justice, several story lines, non are resolved, it appears the producer/director simply had no clue how to bring the threads of the story together. The ending is pathetic, it is like the movie is 75% complete and then ends. Personally, I found the lead man the least convincing of the actors. I have avoided going into the plot as there is absolutely no point as nothing is linked together, this modern idea of letting the audience interpret the end is nothing more than pure laziness as it lets the creators off the hook to bring together the threads of the movie. Avoid this movie as it is not a horror movie or particularly intriguing, the only emotion your left with is anger that you wasted your time watching it.
If someone will explain what this was supposed to be I vow to give them 10 good horror films that are worth watching.3 stars for tricking me into watching this.

reviews.review_title: I couldn't give it no stars, cos believe me, that is all it merits...
reviews.content: What a crock!! Do not waste your time on it, the best actors are the roaches. No plot, no ending, just a load of twaddle (as that eminent film critic, my dad, would say) so do something better with 90 minutes, such as watching paint dry.

reviews.review_title: If You're Looking For Any Kind of Payoff, Look Elsewhere
reviews.content: This is what happens when filmmakers are more fascinated by imagery and concept but don't know how to couch them in a story.Armie Hammer is Will, a bartender in a New Orleans bar who witnesses a fight break out one night while some college kids are in the bar (seemingly unrelated). The kids leave behind one of their phones, which contains disturbing images. All the while, his girlfriend Carrie, played by Dakota Johnson, seems to be studying occult Gnosticism, which seems to be related to what the college kids are involved in.If you're looking for any kind of payoff in this film, you're going to be sorely disappointed. Literally, this film has no payoff. It's more just a bunch of stuff that happens and then, BAM!, end credits. There are times that it seems like it's going somewhere. In fact, it felt like there should have been much more interrelated stuff between different parts of the movie, such as Claire's professor, Steve, being more developed. In fact, I definitely get the impression that this was supposed to be the case, but that it either ended up on the cutting room floor or remained concept-only. It's possible that this happens in "The Visible Filth," the short novel on which this movie is based, but since I haven't read it I can't comment on it.The film we get is not a good film, either. The acting alternates between melodramatic and completely emotionless with no inbetween. Seriously, Brad William Henke is so over-the-top, he makes Jeremy Irons look like he was on Xanax during the "Dungeons & Dragons" movie. Dakota Johnson just sleepwalks through her entire role. Armie Hammer feels like he tries a little too hard to be the everyman. The only actor that seemed believable with genuine subtlety in their role is Zazie Beetz, but her character is pretty much superfluous to the proceedings. Her character could have been cut with little to no change to the plot.What's so terrible about this film, though, is the sheer frustration factor. It's a great idea. I would have loved to see more and have the movie cleaned up to be more cohesive and have an actual payoff. But we're denied all of this. I love the concept of basing a film around occult Gnosticism. However, it's set in such a poor movie that by the end, I found myself wringing my hands less out of fear or feelings of bugs crawling on you (which you might get) and more out of frustration for failure to realize its potential and seeing very easily how it could have been saved. When you're doing the filmmakers work for them, they've got a problem.
This movie Is trying to be a deep twisted thriller but it's just a jumbled mess of plot
The movie doesn't start getting interesting until the next thing you see is the ending credits. What a total waste of time.

So, this movie is a mess indeed. A huge mess. It started with a promise; good cast, interesting plot that could be taken anywhere. I was expecting a lot, even when Dakota J. was in it and I hate her guts. But this movie fell apart awfully. The plot twists don't make any sense, they just tell you the same things over and over again but they don't expand it. There is no additional knowledge of what is truly going on and the viewer is left baffled. The whole "will he cheat on his girl or not?" was a useless plotpoint and brought nothing to the story. The only reason I'm giving this a 3/10 is because the beginning was promising.
Pointless, no story explanation, just finished randomly..

This is the second movie (the first was Kill Chain) I have watched this week where the credits rolled and I sat there stunned that the movie just ended so abruptly. I am not the type to need a clean cut ending. I don't need to know what happens to every character I can use my imagination. However, I do like when the movie feels finished and it definitely didn't. This movie had potential and star power it just seemed like half way through the writers all quit and they hired their toddler children to finish the end.
Another Netflix movie with no ending or explanation.......everything about it was horrible.

reviews.review_title: A psychological and body horror for adults only.
reviews.content: This is more of an atmospheric thriller than horror, though good effective use of some body horror elements.There is not much plot as such, just a descent into psychological horror and madness.Random thoughts: "Does anyone ask for "just two beers" at a bar? Don't you have to specify what type of beer you want? Especially when you are then served an obscure craft beer (Cocodrie) in a bottle?Do young 20-somethings say "I said you shouldn't call me here"? "Here" is clearly a cell phone? This is a line from a movie from 20-30 years ago.The NOLA flavor is a little heavy. The brand new just-ordered-off-the-internet "Morgus the Magnificent" T-shirt is fun, but too much. The film rather deliberately shows four different New Orleans craft beer bottles (well, one of them is Dixie). A wrapped Muffelatta in a fridge, next to some kefir and what looks like kombucha tea and the aforementioned beer bottles.Even having read the "nothing is explained" reviews, I was surprised by the abruptness of the ending. It is not satisfying at all.The whole film mostly is allegory for dealing with a too selfish needy friend. It barely succeeds as that.

Man, I love armie but he gotta use brain in picking his scripts. The movie is so bizzare and pointless. The only thing scary was those cockroaches rambling in every scene. This was such a low for all actors that you end up feeling bad for them.

reviews.review_title: This is the worst movie I think I ever saw.
reviews.content: I am going to be short on this one. This movie has no ending. You will be sitting on the couch thinking give me my 1,5 hours of my life back. You feel like you were abused, leaving you with nothing but questions. It is just total nonsense. Please do yourself a favor and duck away as far as you can from this one.

reviews.review_title: Oh what could have been....but wasn't.......
reviews.content: The plot was vague and sort of subliminal.The general missed theme is one of evil being summoned by a group of kids ( we never learn anything about them because the movie takes a wrong turn and loses itself in a ridiculous sub plot about a drunken bartender that is thoroughly dispicable and abhorable) and the evil gets stronger through wounds. Of course, this theme never gets past infancy and you are left wondering what a wonderful movie could have developed.The acting is beyond horrible for the main roles. There are a few side character roles that were played well.The dialogue is laughable where it isn't supposed to be. Or perhaps it was just the wooden and monotonal delivery.I was so disappointed after watching the previews, because it really appeared that there was a decent budget involved. So many movies in this genre have shaken cameras and terrible sound tracks and stage settings that look like they were recycled from ghetto high school productions. Here, the lighting was good, sound quality decent , but those were the only highs and positives to be said about the whole movie.The special effects are just weird and make no sense. Roaches randomly running about. An occasional bloody scene of something obscure thrown in and you are never quite sure what you are looking at or why. Not scary. Not gross. Just sort of strange and weirdly misplaced and not quite funny but certainly not horror provoking either.None of it ever tied together coherently in the plot department and abysmal acting just kept me cringing.
Completely waste of time, please don't try to watch

Wow, this has to be one of the worst movies ever made. I mean, I get where they were going with it... clearly trying for David Cronenberg vibes, but all they succeeded in creating was a film full of deeply unlikeable characters and some bugs.

The trailer for this made it look great. The storyline stalled quite early on. I say storyline, pppffftttt. You've seen it all before. With a better cast, a complete story, but not as many cockroaches. Utterly pointless. Zzzzzzzzzz

This was just ridiculously confussing for me, and at the end I had hundreds more questions about what's going on than any answers.The ending of the film happened so suddenly and didn't wrap up even one thing, what happened to his gf, why was she going crazy, what was on the laptop, what was inside his friends face, what the hell even happened?I would watch this if you've got time to spare, but I wouldn't bother otherwise, it's started out good, I had high hopes but it just went downhill from there.
Painfully slow and unrewarding. The Irishman lasts for 3 and a half hours and still goes faster than wounds.
The movie would have been ok but it had one of the worst endings of any film I've seen hence why I scored the movie a 4/10Very disappointing!

reviews.review_title: Masterfully crafted atmosphere conjures ceaseless tone of ominous foreboding; coherent and/or compelling narrative&char. development woefully inadequate, comparatively
reviews.content: Excellent use of creepy/macabre motifs paired with an even more skillful use of a lean and sinister string-zested soundtrack that does an effective job at haunting the imagination and sneaking under the skin. Where the story and character development sorely lack or suffer from cliched writing, the production makes up for in smart editing and scare tactics. Wounds may lack in jump scares, but it does an excellent job at using the irksome creepy-crawliness of bugs and backsliding, crippling addiction to craft a charmingly dark and ominous tone throughout the movie that helps compel the viewer forward despite a rather abysmal script dense with one dimensional characters, obscure referencing and borderline-schizophrenic editing/post-production.Wounds isn't much of a film to write home about and it ultimately fizzles out, feeling like nothing but a lump of purely wasted acting talent and discarded plot potential. Like many indie horror films before it, Wounds suffers from a truly engaging concept but fails to effectively execute and deliver a quality plot arch that satisfies. It's nothing more than wasted momentum enshrouded in an poorly woven tapestry of interesting ideas and badly written dialogue.
What a waste of time. Pleaseeeeeee do not see this

This movie started out okay, seemed interesting enough, but then it just got weird! Then from weird it went really bad!!! I struggled to the end and now I can't gain back that time I wasted on this movie!
Is this a horror flick or a romantic movie? On both fronts, it sucks.

Armie Hammer's performance was solid. Some plot lines and characters are introduced that could have been interesting. It goes absolutely no where. It's not even ambiguous, it's just incomplete.

Despite the numerous low ratings on here i gave this film a go. was decent enough, good amount of fairly jumpy jumpscares and then we get to the ending. What an absolute stupid, pointless end. Looks like they ran out of ideas and had to cut the film short. Not even one of those horror endings that people love to hate and leave you guessing. It was just really really awful.
Don't bother watching.

I thought it was going for the slow burner kinda movie.But the plot is going nowhere, just leaves you hanging. I was hoping for everything to make sense in the end but just nothing. They never explained anything. All those supernatural events are all over the place
Characters that you just don't care. The romance between characters are pointless.
It just doesn't give the satisfaction audience deserved in the end.

So the movie is based on a novel, The Visible Filth, that's a good sign, because normally good novels can make their way into movie industry. I haven't read the novel, but unfortunately this movie adaption is just bad.Basically it wants to tell a dark stories about a man, Will, seemingly a good man, ends up giving himself up and got possessed by a supernatural force. And basically that's it. None of the characters were well developed, and the storyline left tons of untold things like, actually, everything. 2 stars is for Hammer's performance.
I wanted to like this movie. The main character was an a-hole from start to finish and I'm suppose to like him? To feel sorry for him? Well. I didn't and for me, that kills the movie.

This film had all the makings of a fantastic horror movie. The cast is amazing, the concept is interesting, and there are some genuinely tense moments that have you holding your breath. Unfortunately it's let down by confused writing - the storyline is all over the place! Characters pop up, only to disappear a few scenes later without adding anything to the plot. They're also hard to care about, because you're not given enough time with any of them for them to become fully fleshed. The plot jumps and twists, but not in a way that feels deliberate. It's almost as if the writers came up with a unique concept but didn't fully understand it themselves, and so the whole film flounders without really going anywhere. Just as you really think things are developing, the film ends so abruptly that you're left feeling cheated. There was a good 40 minutes of "build up" in this movie that was completely unnecessary, and if the "ending" had actually been in the middle of the film, and everything had continued from that point, I think the overall experience would've been far better.
If you plan on watching, prepare yourself for disappointment.

reviews.review_title: "You don't want to see it. You don't want to see it, it's awful."
reviews.content: The above quote from the movie adequately sums up the film. The plot was all over the place. Will is a bartender whose friend gets sick from a badly infected cut on his face. Will lives with girlfriend Carrie but they aren't too happy together. Will longs for friend Alicia but she already has a boyfriend. Will sees murder scenes on the phone he picked up when customers in the bar dropped it. Will is inexplicably reluctant to take the phone to the police despite having friends on the force. Will goes home one night to find Carrie inexplicably catatonic from staring at a website screen she learned of via the phone Will found. Inexplicably, Will doesn't take her for medical help. He just puts her in the bathtub and runs water. This inexplicably cures her. Then they break up for reasons unclear. Now Will is free to go after Alicia but she's not interested. Neither of these relationship issues has anything to do with the plot. They just needed to add running time to the movie. Will visits the sick friend and opens his mouth so that millions of large cockroaches can fly out of the friend's mouth and into Will's as the scene fades to black and the movie ends.The movie is inexplicable. Nothing makes sense and few things have anything to do with one another. It is pure, absolute garbage. It is 1 hour and 35 minutes of your life that you'll never get back. As Will says in the movie, "You don't want to see it. You don't want to see it, it's awful."
So bad Movie dont watch it guys beware From these type of Films which promote illuminati
Is that some kind of art movie? because i didnt get anything. it just waste of time. run away dont watch this movie

reviews.review_title: Could have been so much more
reviews.content: The atmosphere was perfect for a horror, everything else about it wasn't. You couldn't accuse this film of having plot holes as there was no plot. Another half hour of explaining what was going on could have turned it around. I can't even mark this review as having spoilers as the film itself doesn't even have spoilers.

I'm almost speechless for once. It started off promisingly then halfway through everyone in the movie and the movie itself turns flat out weird.
Characters just say and do things which seem to make little sense then before you know it, it ends, just like that!
I made it it to the end which is saying something, as there have been a few Netflix movies of late that I couldn't finish so it at least has something going for it which made me watch it to the end, I just don't know what.

reviews.review_title: Did They Cut Out the Plot?
reviews.content:
The trailer looked interesting and the cast well-known, but was sadly disappointed.
The plot is nearly non-existant: boy fancies girl who isn't his girlfriend, bar fight, some cockroaches, boy alienates everyone, cockroaches, the end.
Acting is not fantastic, production is okay, basics of storytelling missing.
Wouldn't recommend.

reviews.review_title: Slow burner that just fizzles out
reviews.content: Wounds starts well enough, bartender in a dive bar, who's smarter than you think, wasting his life. Things start getting weird when he finds a phone, after a nasty fight & there's cockroaches...& That's it! I'd put the events in the film down to the protagonist's heavy drinking, rather than anything supernatural! There's a bit of tension between the characters, but the film never really escalate beyond that initial tension. I only gave it three stars because I hate cockroaches! (Though, even they don't really amount to anything!)

Often it seems in a time of the 'millennial' films like Wounds are being slated. The film itself does have plot holes but none different to say that of Cronenberg's movies.
This is a strong film with a very eerie tension that permeates its veneer.
It's let down in my opinion is some of the used music beds to create tension with its visuals.
Is they were stronger than perhaps we'd have a different beat altogether.
That said, this is an enjoyable watch but one I probably won't return to.

reviews.review_title: A waste of time and money
reviews.content: A boring and disgusting movie..you don't know the beginning of it from the end..there is no story,there is no plot,and there is no end..what happens?!!! You never know..there is no mystery, excitement, suspense, horror, or anything..a waste of time and money.I sped up the movie in many places because it was so boring and in order to prevent myself from sleeping and my desire to discover the end and what the plot of the movie was .. But it turned out after I offended myself by watching such nonsense that there is nothing and that the movie is empty and not the body of the main actor.If there was a zero rating, I would have given it to the film with all my comfort (that is, if that material was called a movie).
Characters were fleeting. Seriously I wound back a few times to see if I had missed any clues or hints. Worst show ever to start lockdown

The only good thing here is Armie Hammer's performance, and the two stars are for him. This film is a perfect example of male privilege in the film industry. If this director had never made his first film so well this script would not have been picked up. The female characters are so badly written here without any motivation or agency it is obvious not one woman contributed to the making of this story. Why on earth would Dakota Johnson's character ever in a million years pick up with Armie Hammer's character? Why would Zazie Beetz drink in that bar of all places, like, ever? These very put-together women would never be involved! Oh, but they are supporting the male cast, so they have to be these beauties with no minds of their own? Truly sexist writing. Then we get to the story. What? All these set-ups, no payoff? What were the heads? The students following him? Nothing! Not that things need to be entirely explained but this was like a third-rate college screenplay, all the mysteries, nothing panned out. What a complete washout. Hopefully the last time this director gets such a massive opportunity because he wasted it and ruined it, and yet he is going about saying, oh, yeah, it's meant to be like that, when he clearly had no idea about anything and is now just making it up as he goes along to save face. I'm embarrassed this film exists when so many other projects could have been made.

This movie was just awful.
I have just wasted an hour and a half of my life watching something that I had no idea what was even happening. There was absolutely no conclusion to the movie and the storyline was all over the place.
Do not recommend this movie to anybody!
Terrible terrible terrible!!!!!!

reviews.content: You have to read Wounds: Six Stories from the Border of Hell to understand what is going on in this movie. Personally it is one of the most accurate adaptation's of one of the stories in this particular book. Armie Hammer did such an amazing job of bringing this character to life. The director left out a few important things, he must have assumed everyone read the book already.They are summoning Angels

reviews.review_title: The Good, the Bad and the Ugly
reviews.content: The Good: The idea of the movie is intriguing. Pulling otherworldly baddies through the wounds of people is a pretty cool idea.The Bad: The director doesn't seem to understand tension building and payoff, Hammer is stiff and disinterested, his relationship with Dakota makes you wonder how they ever got together. The love triangle takes up too much time.The Ugly: There's no payoff or explanation. That the story gives you this great premise and spends more time wading through the love triangle and then it just ends. Leaves you hanging in all the worst ways and makes you wonder why you wasted time being interested.Watch instead: The Autopsy of Jane Doe.
It contained a lot except for any existence of storyline . This movie could have gone somewhere with this great cast but Instead it flopped into Netflix's toilet where it belongs
Really very bad . Writter What the author was thinking.

This film was so boring, I kept falling asleep and had to rewind to see what I missed, which wasn't much. The first 10 minutes showed great potential but it just plummeted from there. At least I know the meaning of the teeth in the photo, we have a saying in the UK that when something is really boring "it's like pulling teeth" - well there you go, this film is like pulling teeth, a total non-story that I would advise everyone to bypass.

acting is decent, but the story is non existent.

The main problem with Wounds (2019) is that it knows its a horror movie, but doesnt know what type of horror movie it is. This leads to it trying to be all the types of horror movies. You think its mind-games horror, then it becomes demonic horror, but then it goes back to mind games, then its nature horror, then its back to mind-games, then its body horror, then its occult, but it still wants to be nature horror, and it finally decides it all the above in a messy ending.
Although the characters are rather one-dimensional and very cliche, the cast manages to deliver them well and as-written, which is perhaps the movie's only redeeming quality.
Watching it wont take away anything from the viewer, but I doubt it would add any value either.

Loved it. Psychological. Intelligence and spooky. But I hate the end😁
I'll give it this...Hammer is a pleasure to look at. That is all.

reviews.review_title: A modern version of 'The Lost Weekend'
reviews.content: This is a scary movie, but if you're looking for jumpy cheap horror, this ain't it. I don't think most people caught onto what this movie is really about - alcoholism and the deterioration of one man's psyche because of it. It's not about bugs people, learn the meaning of a metaphor and stop taking everything literally. This is a modern and more sleek version of 'The Lost Weekend' which if you haven't seen you should. The phone storyline wasn't really relevant to the story except for the fact that finding the phone was the beginning of the bartenders descent into paranoia and psychosis. The ending, though abrupt, made sense given the context.

I give up on the bigger part of Netflix viewers. Can't explain why people give Netflix productions such high ratings? Clueless, exhausting, senseless movies which lead into nothing. This movie and Eli are the best examples. Seems like they produced, shot and cut the movie in two weeks.

Story goes nowhere, acting is wooden by the leads and it seriously goes nowhere

reviews.review_title: They warned me it was bad...
reviews.content: But I had to see for myself, who know? Well, THEY knew! What a waste of time! Weak plot, no character depth, one wonders what some of the character do AT ALL in the story as they appear to be an integral part of the story, then just disappear... I cannot even praise Hammer's performance, by far the only thing holding this crapfest together, because the story is so uninteresting and utterly forgettable. Avoid at all cost! reviews.review_title: It's on Netflix. This alone should warn you
reviews.content: Total waste of time, such a pointless movie. Dakota Johnson is truly the world's worst actress.

reviews.review_title: I Tried so hard to like it..
reviews.content: I gave it a shot all the way through and was really disappointed to see the credits come on the screen at the end. The way it ended definitely felt like I missed something important but that's not the case...So many questions unanswered, which is never a bad thing. However, in this case we definitely should of had some sort of closure on what was going on lol.There were times when the acting was questionable but I do love Zazie Beetz, she did great!Overall I gave it a 5/10, because it had something good going but really felt empty handed by the end.I wouldn't recommend this to any of my friends. But if your looking to kill time. Then sure, go for it!

reviews.review_title: Better than the general review score
reviews.content:
Worth a watch - Good horror premise with a decent storyline for a change - was seriously thinking of cancelling my Netflix if they didn't turn out a half decent film soon !
Armie Hammer did a very good job portraying sad loser alcoholic bartender with faulty relationships all round - never been a fan of Dakota Johnson though and her role in this does nothing to change that.
If there had been more explanation of the background of the college kids / scary tunnel, less unnecessary swearing and a more intelligent ending then it would definitely rate an 8 or 9.

reviews.review_title: Good acting but leaves you wondering
reviews.content: Despite what obviously ignorant people have written here, there's nothing wrong with the acting in this film, quite the opposite. However, the story is pretty unclear and great potential is wasted with loose ends and a weird ending.

reviews.review_title: Enjoyable film, for the most part
reviews.content: I liked this film, but why couldn't they clean the camera lens in the final shot, It really bugged me.

This is what works:
Creepy atmosphere.
A couple of really creepy scenes.
Gross creature FX.
Disturbing horror imagery.
Armie Hammer gives a decent performance as a deeply unlikeable character!This is what does not work at all:
Way too much emphasis on alcohol & the main character using it to hide from their loser choices in life.
Not enough clarity on the actual story.
Poorly directed & edited.

reviews.review_title: A confusing and annoying mess of a film!
reviews.content: The film's title is deliberately open to interpretation. Unfortunately, so is much of the story.The movie starts off intriguingly as you are introduced to a host of interesting characters in a fairly progressive scene. Unfortunately, what you will have witnessed is the film's peak after about only 15 minutes. Cue 80 minutes of a confusing, convoluted mess. You are carried along a twisted story whilst trying to understand what is going on for most of it. There are some dark scenes which lead you to a false sense of security due to their terrorising nature. However one cannot be frightened of watching something if one does not know what to be frightened of, or indeed why one should be frightened. It is almost like the movie tries to encapsulate every theme going without developing its own identity. Is it a horror? Is it a thriller? Is it a drama? Everything about this film is open to interpretation, even its theme, it seems.The thing that shocked me the most about this movie however was the misplaced profanity. It is utterly pointless and adds nothing to the movie. It comes out of nowhere. Dakota Johnson randomly dropping the C-bomb does not hide the fact that she is awful in this film. You don't see a lot of her (in more ways than one, you can thank 50 shades for that) and delivers an (expected) wooden performance. Armie Hammer and Zazie Beetz do deliver good performances, considering the terrible script.The turning point in the film's story is what lets it down entirely, and is a massive plot hole. The film's antagonists deliberately leave something to be found by their next victim. Now, if you intend on manipulating someone with an object you leave behind, logic would suggest that you would ensure your victim can access whatever it is with ease, in order to become manipulated. The way the film shows how the victim accesses what was left behind is utterly ridiculous and just would not happen in real life without a lot of effort. Which makes you wonder what has happened to other victims, or rather those that couldn't access the object left behind. It is utter nonsense.What you hope to receive by sticking with the film until the end at least is (as much as can be, considering the circumstances) a satisfying ending. Instead the final scenes do nothing but add to the confusing mess you have already witnessed. You are ultimately left with only two conclusive feelings; confusion and annoyance. Confusion over the entire story and annoyance that you just wasted almost 90 minutes of your life that you will never get back.My conclusion is that you avoid this at all costs. You have been warned!

Made an account just to rate this movie. Worst one I ever watched. Started out solid, built up the mystery, started going somewhere and then out of no where I see the credits?... What? Did I click on a YouTube link with half a film uploaded? Nope that's the movie. Like the author got really bored with the storyline and just wrote The End. The actors were great though.

This has to be the best movie I've seen in years.
From the reviews below it's clearly not everyone's cup of tea, which I think is mainly due to his it's presented.This is not a simple movie, it's closer to an interactive experience or metagame.
This is perfect for Netflix, as some parts need to be paused or rewatched in order to even see what the heck is happening.There are parts of the movie which don't make a lot of sense unless you've read the novella... And the other stories set in the same timeline/universe.There are quotes, and hidden references everywhere... For example:The movie begins with a quote from Heart of Darkness by Joseph Conrad.Carrie's essay seen briefly midway through is about the allusions in TS Eliot's The Hollow Men, which itself began with a quote from Heart of Darkness.... And her professor's surname is Conrad.(Carrie's surname is Lynch which could be it's own reference!)A recurring phrase in the author's fiction is "Maybe heaven is a dark place"... Reflecting (I believe) that the supernatural is by it's very nature unknowable, and that fragile concepts like "evil" don't necessarily apply to beings beyond our capacity to understand.Both Heart of Darkness and The Hollow Men deal with the emptiness inside is where we imagine a soul to be, and whether morality can be ever said to exist.In the book version the kids make reference to both Eric and themselves being "just nice suits to wear", while in the film the shallow nature of social media and Eric's life is more implied than explicit.However the film instead explicitly states the ritual inclined is gnostic, and the website Eric views on his girlfriend's laptop makes reference to the wound being used to open up a portal to "Pleroma"... Which is a real concept, and has been translated as simultaneously meaning the spirit world, the act of filling an empty vessel/making something incomplete whole, as well as referring to the individual higher beings themselves.The concept of human beings being shallow and incomplete runs right through the book and film. From the author's other works, the kind of "fulfillment" that is being offered is far less transcendent, and more like we would use a latex glove... Something to be used and discarded, torn and ruptured from having been written by something far greater than ourselves.This is one of several examples I've found so far, just as in the story there is a whole hidden, deeper layer to everything, which only those driven enough to pursue will find... Effectively making the viewer/player act out what the protagonists are doing.If you enjoy games like Cultist Simulator, or Lovecraftian fiction, this is the movie for you.
